intro: Pelargonium vestitum, commonly known as the velvet geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves that range in color from dark green to purplish hues. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, often blooming throughout the summer months. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile addition to gardens. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is widely cultivated as both a garden plant and a houseplant.
